Metadata.title: Dastan Abikov
Metadata.description: Entrepreneur, investor, speaker, activist, and diplomat. Dastan Abikov was born in 1999 in Bishkek, Kyrgyz Republic.

Biography.subtitle: Biography
Biography.title: WAS BORN IN 1999 IN KYRGYZ REPUBLIC

0.description: Dastan Abikov was born in Bishkek, Kyrgyzstan

2.description: Was recognized by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology as one of the most promising young entrepreneurs and received support from the Prime Minister of the Kyrgyz Republic

3.description: Founded a successful contracting company in the construction industry

4.description: Graduated from Tursun Temirova School in Kochkor District, Naryn Region

6.description: Completed a professional education program at Harvard Business School (HBS)

7.description: Graduated from the economic program at the Kyrgyz Economic University (KEU) and developed a socio-economic development program for the Kyrgyz Republic

8.description: Founded the Kyrgyz Fund. Scholarship programs operate under the fund's aegis

9.description: Founded the 'Sustainable Mountain Development Fund' (SMDF) in New York and became a member of the Mountain Partnership at the United Nations (UN)

10.description: Spoke at a commission meeting at the United Nations (UN)

readMore.paragraph1: Dastan Abikov was born in 1999 in Bishkek. At 15, he began his entrepreneurial journey. By 17, he was recognized by the Massachusetts Institute of Technology as a promising young entrepreneur and received support from the Kyrgyz Republic's Prime Minister. In 2017, he founded a successful contracting company and graduated high school at 18.
readMore.paragraph2: At 21, Dastan earned his first million dollars. Since 2020, he has funded the Jiu-Jitsu Federation of Kyrgyzstan, with an athlete winning the under-19 world championship in 2021. He also supports the cultural project “Ilgeri,” which represented Kyrgyzstan at the Venice Biennale and organizes the Museum of Contemporary Art in Bishkek.
readMore.paragraph3: At 22, Dastan completed a professional education program at Harvard Business School. At 23, he finished an economics program at the Kyrgyz Economic University and wrote a socio-economic development program for the Kyrgyz Republic. He founded the Kyrgyz Fund, which offers scholarship programs.
readMore.paragraph4: At 24, he joined the Mountain Partnership at the United Nations and, in 2024, spoke at a UN commission meeting.
